column4: I think my pc's BIOS is detecting 1gb of ram, but ubuntu is only detecting 512 - I have just upgraded from a single stick of 256 to two sticks of 512.  Why would this happen? I've tried both sticks in several combos, but only 512 ever gets recognised.
only by ubuntu or also by the bios?
What video card do you have?
what's that got to do with it? Radeon 9200 I think.
Hmm - it's not onboard is it? cause it might be doing shared memory...
gah, yes, it is onboard, completly forgot I didn't put the 9200 in yet - but sharing 512mb?! Why?
lol, ok, I'll try with a gfx card in - hope this works :-)
if not come back we'll get it fixed:)
nope - wasn't due to shared - with gfx card in still only 512 detected
memtest done by bios shows ~1024mb ok
getting it to run a proper memtest in a minute
memtest86 detects 1gb of fram, but ubuntu doesn't - is it perhaps a kernel issue? 512mb max of ram compiled in somehow?
ok, magically, it's got 1gb somehow now - no idea how, but I'm happy.
